title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Terrorist
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Terrorist 
Offences) Act 2005 (Section 42) (Restrictive Measures concerning Certain 
Persons and Entities with a view to Combating Terrorism) (No. 2) Regulations
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited criminal justice (terrorist offences) act 2005 (section 42) (restrictive measure concerning certain person entity view combating terrorism) (no 2) regulation

title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Act” means the Criminal Justice (Terrorist Offences) Act 2005 (No. 2 of 
2005); 

“Bank” means the Central Bank of Ireland; 

“Council Regulation” means Council Regulation (EC) No. 2580/2001 of 27 
December 20011 as amended by the European acts specified in the Schedule; 

“European act” means an act adopted by an institution of the European Union 
or an institution of the European Communities. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and that is also 
used in the Council Regulation has the same meaning in these Regulations as it 
has in the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - act mean criminal justice (terrorist offences) act 2005 (no 2 2005) bank mean central bank ireland council regulation mean council regulation (ec) no 2580 2001 27 december 20011 amended european act specified schedule european act mean act adopted institution european union institution european community (2) word expression used regulation also used council regulation meaning regulation council regulation

title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: It is a requirement within the meaning of subsection (3) of section 42 of
text_raw:
3. 

It is a requirement within the meaning of subsection (3) of section 42 of 

the Act that a person shall not contravene the Council Regulation. 

1 OJ No. L 344, 28.12.2001, p.70 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st March, 2024.

title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: 4. (1) The Bank may, for the purposes of these Regulations and the
text_raw:
4. (1) The Bank may, for the purposes of these Regulations and the 
Council Regulation, give to any person such directions as it considers 
appropriate. 

(2) A direction under this Regulation shall be in writing. 

(3) It is a requirement within the meaning of subsection (7) of section 42 of 
the Act that a person to whom a direction is given under this Regulation shall 
comply with the direction.
text_norm: 4 (1) bank may purpose regulation council regulation give person direction considers appropriate (2) direction regulation shall writing (3) requirement within meaning subsection (7) section 42 act person direction given regulation shall comply direction

title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: 5. The Criminal Justice (Terrorist Offences) Act 2005 (Section 42)
text_raw:
5. The Criminal Justice (Terrorist Offences) Act 2005 (Section 42) 
(Restrictive Measures concerning Certain Persons and Entities with a view to 
Combating Terrorism) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 22 of 2024) are revoked.

title: that the said Council Regulation is for the purpose of, or will contribute to,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the enforcement of Council Regulation (EC) 
No. 2580/2001 of 27 December 2001, as amended. 

Section 42 of the Criminal Justice (Terrorist Offences) Act 2005 creates an 
offence for breach of the provisions of these Regulations, provides for 
appropriate penalties and empowers the Minister for Finance to make 
regulations providing for such incidental, supplementary and consequential 
provisions as appear to the Minister to be necessary. 

The Regulations revoke previous domestic instruments created under Section 
42 of the Criminal Justice (Terrorist Offences) Act 2005 in relation to Council 
Regulation (EC) No.2580/2001 of 27 December 2001, as amended. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [75]
